Name: sodium silicate production, furnace process, solid product | sodium silicate, solid | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: The furnace process is one of the two main processes used to produce sodium silicate. The other one is the hydrothermal process.;;In the furnace process, water glass is produced directly by melting pure silicon sand and soda. Temperatures of approx. 1400 Â°C are required for this process. The sodium silicate produced can then be used directly in a solid form.;;This represents an average technology in Europe.
